utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: -- locations. We have five locations --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Great.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: -- and that will all be narrowed down. I can only say this. When I came into office people thought we were going into nuclear war, OK, and now they're saying wow --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: -- it looks like that's going to be taken care.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: Mr. President --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I think we're doing very well. Let's see what happens.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: OK. We're running out of time but when we came down after your first month in office and we did that big famous now interview in the East Room --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: -- Ainsley asked you a question to grade your first month in office. Now, fast-forward. You've been in office over a year. Last year, you said in the first month I give myself an A for effort and a C for messaging because you were having trouble -- the White House was -- explaining what you were doing. How would you grade yourself now?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Look, I'm fighting a battle against a horrible group of deep-seated people -- drained the swamp -- that are coming up with all sorts of phony charges against me, and they're not bringing up real charges against the other side. So we have a phony deal going on and it's a cloud over my head. And I've been able to do -- to really escape that cloud because the message now everyone knows -- it's a fix, OK. It's a witch hunt and they know that and I've been able to message it. I would give myself an A+. Nobody has done --

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: -- what I've been able to do and I did it despite the fact that I have a phony cloud over my head that doesn't exist. It was what the Democrats used to try and make an excuse for their loss of an election -- for their loss of the Electoral College that they should never lose because the Electoral College is set up perfectly for the Democrats and this was an absolute total beating in the Electoral College. They should never lose the Electoral College and they did --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: But --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: -- and they got thwamped (ph).

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: But does it make you want to talk to Mueller and put an end to it? Does it make you want to talk to him because that's what Rudy Giuliani --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Well, if I can. The problem is that it's such a -- it's such -- if you take a look they're so conflicted. The people that are doing the investigation -- you have 13 people that are Democrats. You have Hillary Clinton people. You have people that worked on Hillary Clinton's foundation. They're all -- I don't mean Democrats, I mean like the real deal. And then you look at the phony Lisa Page and Strzok and the memos back and forth, and the FBI. And by the way, you take a poll at the FBI. I love the FBI, the FBI loves me. But the top people in the FBI, headed by Comey, were crooked. You look at McCabe where he takes $700,000 from somebody supporting Hillary Clinton. He takes $700,000 for his wife's campaign. And by the way, didn't even spend that money. They kept some of it because under that law you're -- he took seven. He took $700,000 from a group headed by Terry McAuliffe who was under investigation by McCabe and the FBI and that investigation disappeared. He took $700,000. And you look at the corruption at the top of the FBI. It's a disgrace. And our Justice Department, which I try and stay away from, but at some point I won't.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Our Justice Department should be looking at that kind of stuff, not the nonsense of collusion with Russia. There is no collusion with me --

utterances.speaker: EARHARDT
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: -- and Russia, and everyone knows it.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Everyone. We could talk to you all day but it looks like --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: -- you have a million things to do.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Well, you could have --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: But I hope you can join us again, Mr. President.

utterances.speaker: EARHARDT
utterances.utterance: Thank you so much for much for being with us.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: And, Ainsley, good luck with your book. It's going to be a winner.

utterances.speaker: EARHARDT
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: And happy birthday to Melania.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: We'll see you next Thursday, Mr. President.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: OK, thank you.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: The phone line's open.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Sounds OK.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: Call in again some time.

utterances.speaker: EARHARDT
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Good. Thank you, bye.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Very nice of you to call in. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
